citations.narrative:
The wall of an enclosure housing one adult dog contained a large area of peeling paint, exposing the material of the wall
behind it. This material cannot be cleaned and sanitized.
Walls that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized can pose a health risk for the animal contained therein.
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they enable all surfaces in contact with the dogs to be
readily cleaned and sanitized or be replaceable when worn or soiled.
Correct by: August 30th, 2025.

A plastic enrichment and housing item in an enclosure housing several naked mole rats had been worn down creating a
sharp edge. This could injure the animals in contact with this item.
Indoor housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. This item was removed from
the enclosure at the time of inspection.
Correct from this day forward: July 30th, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist
Lemnique Wafer, Assistant Director n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The wall of an enclosure housing one adult dog contained a large area of peeling paint, exposing the material of the wall 
behind it. This material cannot be cleaned and sanitized. 
 
Walls that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized can pose a health risk for the animal contained therein. 
 
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they enable all surfaces in contact with the dogs to be 
readily cleaned and sanitized or be replaceable when worn or soiled.  
 
Correct by: August 30th, 2025. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
A plastic enrichment and housing item in an enclosure housing several naked mole rats had been worn down creating a 
sharp edge. This could injure the animals in contact with this item. 
 
Indoor housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. This item was removed from 
the enclosure at the time of inspection. 
 
Correct from this day forward: July 30th, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

Additional Inspectors: 
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist 
Lemnique Wafer, Assistant Director n
